website_summaries.verdict: The Sigma 50mm F1.4 EX DC HSM captures a lot of light, but it doesn't offer the edge-to-edge sharpness of more recent Sigma lenses.
pros: Includes soft case and lens hood
cons: Weak edge performance, even when stopped down

customer_reviews.title: Essential.  Incredible.  Awesome.  Its a necessity for anyone who wants their work to seriously stand out.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my EOS Rebel T5i and used it for the first time at my little brothers wedding. This is a portrait lens so there is no zoom at all and getting large family group shots requires positioning myself at the alternate end of the country. However, for everything in-between, this thing is the greatest lens I have ever used. The shots are crystal clear and the low depth of field scrubs on the backgrounds giving each shot a professional 3D look. Low light, action, closeups... Everything came out incredible. Each time I showed someone the shot I took of them they all said the same thing.. "Wow that is an awesome camera." Best investment I have made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great visuals, but noisy and slow focus
customer_reviews.text: I got the used lens for my Canon 70D and although the photo and video quality is PHENOMENAL, the lens clicks and whirs during focus, which is very distracting during filming. It's also a bit slow to focus, so I've missed some good shots because of it. It's a bit frustrating overall and I'm wondering if it's because it's used. Any pros out there who could tell me if this is normal? Anyways, considering it's $700 less than the new, I've got to say it's totally worth getting if you're on a tight budget. If you have the money, get the new one!!!
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Great little nifty fifty.
customer_reviews.text: I love this little lens When I purchased it years ago it was well rated and even beat the Canon equivalent in some regards. After time I have used it when I want the properties this lens provides, ESPECIALLY the f1.4. It is in my kit whenever I venture out.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Riddle

customer_reviews.title: Sold my Nikon 50mm 1.4G for this
customer_reviews.text: I've shot with a bunch of different 50mm, mostly Nikon. I actually sold my Nikon 50mm 1.4G and replaced it with this and I'm so glad i did. The way this lens renders bokeh is different than the Nikon lens. It gives a nice character to the picture. The AF on this lens is hands down faster then the Nikon 50mm 1.4g. At the same time the Sigma is bigger, heaver, and the glass is more exposed, BUT it is completely worth it. Don't hesitate to buy this over the Nikon 50mm because of the brand. The sigma primes are great.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mendonca

customer_reviews.title: Get one!
customer_reviews.text: * First, would like to start off that this review is from someone that has to be able to depend on every single item in his camera bag to earn a paycheck. I was on the fence between the Canon and the Sigma. After getting a chance to test them both, the Sigma just felt good and worked better for my type of shooting. I am very impressed with the build of this lens and the quality of the work I can deliver from it. SHARP and CRISP ! Low light it amazing and it will not let you down.
customer_reviews.author: Movielighter

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to the 50L
customer_reviews.text: I have owned 2 copies of this lens and both of them were good copies, but really needed to be calibrated my sigma service. I sent them in and they came back sharper than ever! Sigma's reputation is beginning to change at its quality control and support. My first copy was of the original shimmery painted finish, the current copy that I have is of the slick glossy finish. The autofocus is consistent and accurate. The Bokeh is gorgeous and vignetting is well controlled. It shipped with a lens pouch that is good quality. I use this lens when I shoot weddings and I trust it completely!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B

customer_reviews.title: Focus not good enough
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this lens. The build quality is fantastic, and I love the bokeh and quality of the pictures it takes. I also like that it came with a lens hood. However, the focus is off at the larger apertures. I contacted Sigma, who said that they needed to calibrate the lens to my camera. I sent my camera and the lens to them in NYC, and when it came back, the focus was worse than when I sent it. I'm really disappointed, because like I said, I really wanted to love it and I spent money shipping it to Sigma. But I just don't. Please don't make the same mistake I did.
customer_reviews.author: BeeDub

customer_reviews.title: I have nothing bad to say about this lens at all
customer_reviews.text: Took me a while to find what I was looking for. I am used to zoom lenses so the semi transition was a little different. Sharp photos are given from this lens. I have nothing bad to say about this lens at all. For the price, and the other competitors pricing...its a no brainer. Get It!!!
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Great crisp lense!
customer_reviews.text: I bough a new Nikon D610 and also bought this Sigma 50mm. Right at the first few shots I noticed the sharpness of my photos. My family and friends also noticed the beautiful pictures. The only minor issue it has is the vignetting when aperture is at its widest but overall it is what is being advertised. It comes with a lense hood and the lense is made in Japan which is a big deal for me. But if budget is not issue I would like to recommend getting the latest version of this lense which is approx. $1000.
customer_reviews.author: Jemistel

customer_reviews.title: Solid buy/ Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Product showed up on time, was wrapped to survive the apocalypse and came out of the box pristine. Autofocus is on point, no extraneous sounds or play in the body. changed out the lens on my canon to this 50mm and began shooting immediately. Sigma delivers again with crisp sharp images and an incredibly fast AF system.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!  Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This lens is amazing! I totally love it. I've become such a fan of Sigma lenses. This lens is fast. Fantastic bokeh. Perfect for shooting little ones running around the house. My two all-time favorite lenses are both Sigmas. I am using this on my Canon 70D and it was so worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Chillami

customer_reviews.title: What a beautiful blurry background
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lens becasue I need a low light lens for some particular shooting sessions. I read this lens has a better boken and blurry background than the new and similar priced Nikon 50 f1.4 G. And I saw quite some people sold their new Nikon 50 f1.4 G and replaced with this Sigma instead. The lens I received is very sharp even at f1.4. The boken and background are very shallow and creamy, simply beautiful. I never try shooting this at small spertures like f2.8 and above though. So I don't know it's performance there. But that's not the purpose I buy it for anyway. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: pokeba

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: Bokeh, bokeh, and more bokeh. I love this lens, it's the first I reach for when I'm doing portraiture, and it's always in my kit. Sure, there are better, more expensive lenses that do the same thing, but if you can't afford one of those, this is a fantastic option.
customer_reviews.author: Katy W.

customer_reviews.title: Bulky but great lens.
customer_reviews.text: This lens focuses quickly and the limited depth of field really highlights your subject. It really steps up my photography to looking more professional and I'm able to get more artsy with it. My only negatives are that it's large for a 50mm and that the focus ring doesn't turn very much so it's too easy to accidentally overshoot or undershoot your focus because a little turn moves the focus dramatically. That's something I'm sure I'll get used to though. I'm very happy I bought this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We love this lens
customer_reviews.text: We love this lens, the bokeh we get at the higher apertures is beautiful, the clarity and sharpness the lens delivers are excellent, it is user friendly, fast and quiet auto-focus, our portraits are so much better than they were with the kit lenses we had it is just amazing what a high quality lens can do, and for the price, you can't beat this lens. Sigma has a newer version of the 50mm out now, but if you are on a budget and don't want to spend $900 this lens will absolutely do the job.
customer_reviews.author: John Hearne

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased and would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I researched several lenses before my decision and I have absolutely no regrets. The lens simply produces stunning images. I had a 18-55 kit lens before and I cannot imagine probably ever putting it back on my camera after seeing the difference. The lens focuses very, very fast and quiet. The depth of field with the lens wide open is so small that if you're shooting an even slightly moving subject, you may mistake the lens for being soft or slightly out of focus when your subject simply moved an inch or two after focusing. By f/1.8 the glass is super sharp. I would highly recommend to any once needing a prime 50.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: I love this lens.
customer_reviews.text: My Canon 50mm 1.8 broke (my fault) so I felt I might as well purchase another 50mm. No focusing issue with mine, the pictures look fantastic and I can't wait to shoot more. I've already shot "couples" pictures for my sister and her husband. My parents and most recently myself and my girlfriend. I love this lens. It's on my camera all the time. I can't wait to upgade to a different body and shoot some more. Definitely recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Bradley P

customer_reviews.title: Focus Broken - :(
customer_reviews.text: This lens arrived with the focusing mechanism already broken. Wouldn't focus on a dang thing. Both autofocus and manual focus refused to work. Really disappointed, as I was looking forward to using this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Saul Valdez

customer_reviews.title: I too wanted to love it. Chronic front focusing straight out of the ...
customer_reviews.text: I too wanted to love it. Chronic front focusing straight out of the gate. Love the build and the feel. But I didn't want to spend $50 shipping it in to fix a focus problem on a brand-new lens. And no, I did not have the multi point focus setting on. I never do. But it front focused about 1 inch, enough to not get the sharpness on the eyes that I'm looking for. The bokeh is really amazing, much better than the Canon version which I now own. If you can figure out that focusing issue, I think it's a superior lens for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Nanny B

customer_reviews.title: fast AF and pretty much amazing when it shot wide open with the ...
customer_reviews.text: i recently got this lens to go with my current canon 60D b/c my nifty fifty from canon just wasn't cutting it. this lens really does well. sharp, clear, fast AF and pretty much amazing when it shot wide open with the DoF. now today i just got my canon 6D and now i see its true potential. on a full body this lens surpasses all my expectations. from the moment i took the first snap with it and looked at the photo i knew that i made the right decision with this lens.
customer_reviews.author: travis walden

customer_reviews.title: The build quality and image quality are much better than the Canon 50/1
customer_reviews.text: I have a Canon 5D Mark III and I've been looking for a normal prime lens to go with it. The build quality and image quality are much better than the Canon 50/1.4. That's why I want to love this lens, but after two copies from Amazon, neither of them focused properly. They both front focus on objects close up (>+20 in AF Microadjustment). And they back focused on subjects futher away (-7 AF Microadjustment). Therefore, setting the MAF on the camera wouldn't have helped. I didn't want to spent the time or energy going back and forth with Sigma's repair center on a *brand new* lens. What a pity. Only if their QA were better.
customer_reviews.author: amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lens!
customer_reviews.text: I am using the Sigma 50mm f/1.4 with my Canon 5D MkII and have experienced no focusing issues, even in extremely low light. I only use the center auto-focus point though, so I can't report on how the lens will perform in other scenarios. It is extremely sharp, and the bokeh is beautiful and smooth. The only issue that I have noticed is that it consistently underexposes. Not a problem in manual mode(just lower the shutter speed a bit) but in the auto modes you will probably need to adjust the exposure compensation a little bit.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew P. Welch

customer_reviews.title: Super Satisfied Photographer
customer_reviews.text: Photo captured with the Sigma Art 50mm f/1.4 DG HSM purchased from Tony’s. I am thrilled with the quality, near silence while manipulating the lens, and the safe shipment of my new to me lens. It has quickly become my favorite lens as manipulating it has become more and more second nature. I highly recommend Tony’s Camera Shop! I will definitely be purchasing from Tony’s again.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect, with some minor adjustments
customer_reviews.text: I would love this lens but it seems I got one where I had to do some micro adjustments. I was hoping I would not recieve that batch but after a few adjustments of the lens, it's perfect. you can't beat the price. it's solid and on the pro level without the pro price compared to canon. I would give it 5 stars if I didn't have to do any adjustments. I have other pro sigma lens, all perfect out of the box. Sorry sigma on this one.
customer_reviews.author: deezTx

customer_reviews.title: Love this lens
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this lens for several years now. The pictures achieved are nothing less than breathtaking. Creamy bokeh is easily achieved, while keeping the subject tack sharp. I would highly recommend this for anyone wanting a step up form the "Nifty-50" 1.8 by Canon. Very good build quality, very quiet and fast. The only knock is, it sometimes hunts in low-light conditions, but not anything too dramatic.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen D. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a refurbished one for my Canon Rebel T5i and it has proved to be an excellent lens. I noticed comments about auto-focusing issues on certain DSLR's but the auto-focus on this lens has been superb. I would highly recommend getting a refurbished one if available because at that price it just seems too risky to buy not knowing how well the auto-focus works. I was originally going to just use manual focus (superb as well) and get really good at it but was pleasantly surprised to find the auto-focus works well. It is very fast and accurate for the most part. It has very solid construction, nice weight, and is a really great piece of glass.
customer_reviews.author: Noah Barber

customer_reviews.title: Buy this lens!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant about buying this lens especially after reading the reviews about the focusing problem. I just received the lens yesterday and so far I have not seen any problem with the focusing. The Sigma is a very well built lens and "so far" it takes very good pictures and the bokeh is excellent, because of the 1.4 aperture this is a good lens for low light photography. I believe that this lens will get a real workout. I have the "nifty 50" but it does not even come close to this lens. I really do believe that if you buy this lens you won't return it.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Finally! Consistent focus near and far.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third copy and I finally have one that is working perfectly. I am a bit surprised but it appears just like other reviewers have said (some of them are copies are brilliant others are garbage). The other two copies I try had been getting around the edge of the photo, and the focusing was soft at all distances. So I can only assume that if you have dramatic amounts of vignetting around the edge of your lens you may want to check the lenses critical focus.
customer_reviews.author: User01

customer_reviews.title: Better than the newer version at a fraction fo the price.
customer_reviews.text: This lens is a sleeper. Bokeh and low light performance is amazing given it's price. No focusing issues. Far better value per dollar than the newer version.
customer_reviews.author: Unanimouse

customer_reviews.title: Sigma 50 mm vs Canon 50 mm F1.4
customer_reviews.text: I had both Canon and Sigma 50mm F1.4. Both lens perform equally well over F2.0. However, the major usage of this lens is at F1.4. At F1.4, Sigma beats canon easily in terms of sharpness, bokeh, saturation and contrast. The build quality of Sigma is obviously much better than Canon's. At F1.4, both lenses have front or back focus problem with different cameras. If used on Canon 5D II, it can be adjusted using AF microadjustment or sent back to the service centres for adjustment pertaining to that camera.
customer_reviews.author: J. F. Zhou

customer_reviews.title: Tack sharp
customer_reviews.text: Tack sharp even at f/1.4. Snappy auto focus and great build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Whitman

customer_reviews.title: reasonable fast auto focus and great low Light performance
customer_reviews.text: This thing blows the canon 1.4 and 1.8 out of the water. Solid build, reasonable fast auto focus and great low Light performance. This was my first sigma lens and I may consider upgrading it to the new 50mm model down the road.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Lens has serious focus issues. Seems to only want ...
customer_reviews.text: Lens has serious focus issues. Seems to only want to focus on rear subjects. I'd seen a couple of reviews warning about this but decided to give it a try anyway. I am in the process of sending the lens to the Sigma service center for repair. Update on customer service and whether or not they fixed the problem will be posted later.
customer_reviews.author: New Orleans

customer_reviews.title: Great 50mm lens for walking around
customer_reviews.text: Great 50mm lens for walking around. I had used this on a 7D (crop frame) and a 6D (full frame) and got very sharp picture on each camera. Of course the 6D was better because it's a full frame camera. The f1.4 allowed me to get some pictures in a church that I would not have gotten otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B

customer_reviews.title: Sigma 50mm f/1.4 EX DG HSM Lens for Nikon Digital SLR Cameras
customer_reviews.text: Should have waited another two weeks to buy this lens - I see that the price went down $50.00 - nevertheless, it is the first non-Nikon lens I have acquired in 30 yrs and anguished over purchasing a 3rd party product reading reviews and articles for 6 weeks - After using it for only a month I am pleased with the Bokeh, its overall performance, but I have challenged the AF considerably and think I will get used to it. The finish is a bit wanky and it is considerably heavier than a Nikon equivalent, but will consider a Sigma again for my next lens (likely a super wide angle zoom)
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: This is the first 3rd party lens that I bought. I only had Canon "L" lenses up to this purchase. Sigma made me a believer with this lens. The build, quality, looks and the pictures make this lens, in my opinion, equal to the Canon "L" that I expect. I will look at Sigma when I shop for my next lens.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Product arrived as described in the ad in excellent condition and on time
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived as described in the ad in excellent condition and on time. I am very pleased with the quality of the packaging and the lens. My initial trials of the lens have yielded crisp, sharp images as advertised and the low light capability is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: navyvet91

customer_reviews.title: Solid performer 3.5 years.
customer_reviews.text: Summary: This has been my go-to lens for 3.5 years now. I've purchased others lenses, rented others, but almost every shoot I'm on this lens comes out and the others stay in my bag. I've traveled the world with it, been to Burning Man, camping, and more. I could bore you with technical details, but others have done it and for the most part they are accurate. This is an awesome lens. If I had to complain, I wish it could focus closer, but there is no such thing as a perfect lens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sigma 50mm f/1.4 (Nikon mount)
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens. Luckily, I have a good copy (so far). This replaces my Nikon 50mm f1.8G. Don't get me wrong, there is nothing wrong with my old Nikon 1.8G. It is a very good lens. However with the Sigma, I can open it up to f1.4 which makes the background a little bit creamier. But keep in mind that at f1.4 it can be a bit harder to get sharp focus due to very shallow depth of field. Overall, I like it and intend to keep it as long as I'm not encountering any quality issues with it. Highly recommend it to anyone who wants to shoot at wider apertures.
customer_reviews.author: icemanfoto

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bokah when wide open
customer_reviews.text: I feel that this lens has lived up to my expectations. I have only had limited time to use it, however my portrait shots have been remarkable. Macro shots... I need some work. Nice Bokah when wide open. And, killer star shots, but finding the sweet spot for focus on stars was tough. This lens hunts for focus under low contrast solutions. All in all, I am pleased and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LazyBear

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lens for both APS-C and Full Frame . Effective DOF on APS-C is 80mm and still looks great.
customer_reviews.text: This lens creates some stunning images. In my first few days of playing around, I got some really great shots with little effort. One of the best features of this lens is the build quality and the 1.4 aperture. It allows for some seriously drastic images the AF is superior to other 50mm lenses such as the canon EF 50mm and Tamron. Highly recommend if you can get it for under $400.
customer_reviews.author: Syd

customer_reviews.title: ITS HUGE
customer_reviews.text: After getting over the size,I tried out the Sigma 50mm. Its awesome,great, fabulous pictures.No problem with focus - just perfect pictures. AT f1.4 it gets a little hairy and I think this is where some of the focus issues are - at f 1.4 the DOF is very limited. Pictures were razor sharp from f 2.0 on.The 77mm filters are a little pricey. ITS HUGE. Build quality is excellent. SOLD my NIKON 50mm. That should say something.
customer_reviews.author: William G. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: ... using this lens for a few days now and love the quality of it
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this lens for a few days now and love the quality of it. I purchased a Canon 50mm 1.2L before and had to return it because the quality and the sharpness of it. Would recommend this one over the Canon 50mm. Also the price is SO much cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Tien Huynh

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's a good lens for the intermediate level for portrait photography.
customer_reviews.author: Caspar S.

customer_reviews.title: Very good 50/1.4
customer_reviews.text: Very good 50, I like it better than the Canon 50, much better build. I have since upgraded to the 50 Art. Awesome piece of kit.
customer_reviews.author: Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: loving this lens
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the lens. Wide open is surprisingly sharp. Shallow depth of field takes some getting use to when wide open, but what photos! My first non Canon L lens, but it is my go to lens when 50mm range is called for. A bit tight for my smaller censor size. Used on Canon 50D. because of cropped sensor, I might have been better off with a 35mm instead of a 50mm.
customer_reviews.author: K. Leedom

customer_reviews.title: Five stars all the way.
customer_reviews.text: This lens is a bit large and heavy but worth it's weight in gold. On my D7000 it is the equivalent of a 75mm, great for people shots. It is sharp across the field at f1.4 and by f2.8n it is extremely sharp. Due to the oversize front element there is virtually no light fall of even at 1.4. Auto focus is fast and precise. I normally keep a 16-85mm lens on for my "walk about" lens but more and more I find this lens on my camera. Best $500 I've ever spent on a lens.
customer_reviews.author: William Green

customer_reviews.title: Best 50mm better than the canon!
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING LENS and a fantastic deal when buying used. I haven't taken this lens of since I bought it it's AMAZING. Definitely try this one before you go with the comparable canon!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: This lens is a gem that all camera users should ...
customer_reviews.text: This lens is a gem that all camera users should have in their arsenal. I'm learning how important this lens is in low light shooting situations. Just recently use this lens to photograph a birthday party in a lounge. The results blew my mind.
customer_reviews.author: Derwin Avery

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lens
customer_reviews.text: Had this lens for 3 weeks now. Awesome. Put it through its paces. Even done my first engagement shoot with it. Sooo much crisper images than my other lenses. The glass is so wide. Awesome sweet spot. So nicely made. Just an all round solid lens. I think I have to find lenses to match it now as my current Tamron 17-55, Nikkor 70-300 etc pale in comparison. Bugger.
customer_reviews.author: Alastair Battson

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic lens. Buying it from Amazon warehouse deals made ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic lens. Buying it from Amazon warehouse deals made it less than a 1/3 of the cost of the 2nd version. Sharp enough and beautiful portraits. A good solution until when I can afford (or am prepared to bite the bullet) for the second version.
customer_reviews.author: Neil P.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful lens.
customer_reviews.text: I've been a Nikon user since the F first came out in 1959, but I have to admit that Sigma's lenses are generally better today, especially the EX DG HSM series - they focus faster and more quietly, and I've found that the image quality is at least as good as Nikon's glass. This is a terrific lens - I just wish Sigma made a f/1.2.
customer_reviews.author: Pumbala

customer_reviews.title: It is amazing in low light and I super quiet and fast
customer_reviews.text: This is my everyday lens for taking pictures of my family as well as hobby photos. It is amazing in low light and I super quiet and fast. I have never had any auto-focusing issues as others have pointed out.
customer_reviews.author: W. Farber

customer_reviews.title: Stunning Lens
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before purchasing this lens because it is more expensive than the Nikon version, or at least pretty similar in price. This lens ROCKS! It is one of my most used and best lenses. Super sharp, super fast, and marvelous in low light. Cannot tell you how many compliments I get on the photos that I shoot with this lens.
customer_reviews.author: bookgirl

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens, Super Sharp...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an upgrade from the Canon 50mm 1.8. And I was impressed with the quality for the price. The focus seems faster and more accurate than the Canon. The quality of the photos I'm taking seems to have improved. I have to admit it could be this new lens. One drawback is that I do notice a little chromatic abberation when wide open. All in all it's a great lens for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Hector

customer_reviews.title: Not a Sigma
customer_reviews.text: My Sigma docking station tells me that this is not a Sigma lens
customer_reviews.author: Tim Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this lens! I did a lot of research before buying it and am glad I got this one. Other people have tried it and loved it as well, great lens for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy A

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Very fun lens, and worth the price of admission. You can take some great photos with it, and I believe that it requires a bit more effort, but when you really get good with it and dial it in, you'll be very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: gabba

customer_reviews.title: great lens, fast focus, and sharp
customer_reviews.text: I received my copy on Saturday and have used it on my Nikon D800. It snaps on single focus point, no front or back so far. I haven't checked with the Focal Focusing software that I have but looking at the photos I have taken with it, focus seems spot on. On continuous focus, it is somewhat noisy. Until it is thoroughly test, it gets 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: P. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the Canon 1
customer_reviews.text: My main lens! Much better than the Canon 1.8 STM. The focus ring is much better for professional video recording. Focus isnt always sharp and sometimes SLOW however the lens is weighty and nice in the hands.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M.

customer_reviews.title: My daughter is an aspiring photographer... She's ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is an aspiring photographer... She's had her eye on this lens for a year and now is thrilled to finally have it... She loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Milo

customer_reviews.title: Good lens for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this lens wanted the canon 1.2 but could not totally swing it. This lens has nice color and takes great photos. It isn't perfectly sharp wide open but I get good consistency when I bump it up to like 1.8 or 2.0 overall I'm pretty happy and am thrilled to save the extra grand
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I think I received a dud :(
customer_reviews.text: After going back and forth with the "should I's" about getting a 50mm 1.4, I own the Nikon 1.8 and I love it but wanted to try out the 1.4, I decided on the Sigma based mainly on the price. It seemed just as good as the Nikon version on paper but boy was I wrong. I've had the lens for 1 week and all my test shots are really soft. I also tried calibrating with no success. Returning today but I'm not soured on the lens and have requested a replacement. Hopefully I'll get a better one this time :)

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lens.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Canon EOS 5D MK 2 and this lens is just amazing. Sharp and clear as a tack. Great Bokeh at low F stops. Also use this on a Canon EOS SL1 and with the conversion makes a great portrait lens. Buy this and save some money over the Canon version of this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Quentin J Buffington

customer_reviews.title: You won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent lens that I recommend to anyone who doesn't want to spend a fortune on a 50mm f1.4 lens. This lens is so reliable, its focus system is so fast that I can guarantee you that you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Ka

customer_reviews.title: Beat Canon models.
customer_reviews.text: I had both Canon 50mm models and this Sigma is far superior on both construction and image quality. The HSM motor makes a world of difference and even in very low light conditions, the lens seems to have no issue focusing correctly. I've tested on both high and low ISO setting with my 5D Mark II and 1D Mark II, it is simply incredible. The color aberrations, typical of my other $90 Canon models , seems not impact this Sigma lens, I've conducted a few back to back tests and the results are speaking on their own. This Sigma lens is better than the Canon. Highly recommended.

customer_reviews.author: Andrew Jenks

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect... but excellent prime lens
customer_reviews.text: I'm a photo hobbyist who likes to do my research. I purchased this lens 8 months ago and it produces great creamy bokeh when you're after shallow DOF. Solid construction, smooth matte finish. The AF is not dead-on and sometimes lingers, but that's what you can expect from the rebel's AF system. Manual focus + liveview fixes this. I never shoot wider than f1.8. At f1.4 the blooming is off the charts and you can't get any remotely sharp images. I got this lens to use with my APS-C camera as well with a prospective FF camera. Overall not perfect, but still one of my favorite lenses.

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens for my Canon 7D

customer_reviews.author: Keepod

I find there is a creaminess to the images produced, especially in the bokeh, that is so, so gorgeous and desirable. That bokeh quality matters! Yes, they are big and heavy and use large filters. I find the af speed just as fast as other lenses I've used (Nikon). Make sure to buy only if you have a camera that allows you to fine tune focus, or you may have to send it and your camera back to Sigma for calibration (or not, you could get a perfect copy right out of the box). This lens is worth the price and the extra weight in your camera bag.

I'm very pleased with the lens. Very sharp. Bright colors with good contrast. Good bokeh. Fast focus. I've had some out of focus shots at f1.4 in poor light and with low contrast subjects, but this is very difficult for any camera/lens combo. Overall a great lens and highly recommended.

When used correctly, it produces wonderful detail at the focal point, acceptable blur and vignetting off-axis, and pleasing bokeh.
